userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections and Archives are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Dorman Davidson Scrapbooks, WLU Coll. 0154, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Dorman Davidson was a lawyer and poet in Lexington, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains newspaper clippings of Dorman's poems, letters, and essays on various subjects published in the Lexington Gazette and other papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.
